data.title: DePaul University Blue Demons
data.meta_description: Jalen Terry (3) Guard - 2022-23 Played in 24 games with 16 starts where he averaged 5.7 points, 3.0 rebounds and 1.5 assists per game. Shot 38.8 percent from...
data.text:
2022-23

Played in 24 games with 16 starts where he averaged 5.7 points, 3.0 rebounds and 1.5 assists per game.

Shot 38.8 percent from the field on the season, including 36.5 percent from three-point range.

Scored a season-high 14 points in the first round of the BIG EAST Tournament against Seton Hall (3/8) where he shot 5-of-6 and was a perfect 4-of-4 from behind-the-arc in addition to two steals.

Terry set DePaul BIG EAST Tournament records in field goal percentage and three-point field goal percentage.

Scored eight points with five rebounds and a steal at #14 UConn (3/1).

Had three-straight games in double-digit scoring against UTEP (12/10), Creighton (12/25) and Georgetown (12/29).

Dished out a season-high five assists against the Hoyas in addition to five boards and two steals.

Scored seven points with six rebounds against Providence (1/1).

Tallied 11 points in DePaul's overtime comeback victory at Loyola-Chicago (12/3) in addition to five rebounds, two assists and two steals.

Started the first four games of the season, including a nine-point performance in the 22-23 opener against Loyola Md. (11/7).

2021-22

Played in 27 games with 18 starts and tallied 10 games in double figure scoring.

Ranked among BIG EAST leaders in all games in assists averaging 3.1 assists per game.

Was 12th among conference leaders in assists in BIG EAST games only, averaging 3.3.

Scored 16 points against Marquette (3/2) with eight rebounds.

Dished out six assists with three rebounds at Georgetown (2/24).

Played all 40 minutes against Creighton (2/17) where he scored 18 points with six rebounds.

Posted 11 points, six boards and four assists against Butler (2/15).

Tallied 15 points at Providence (2/12) with five rebounds and five assists while playing 44 minutes.

Had another five rebound and five assists performance against Georgetown (2/9) in addition to 10 points scored.

Notched nine points, eight assists and three rebounds against Xavier (1/19).

Scored 28 points against Seton Hall on 7-of-14 shooting and an impressive 11-of-13 performance at the free throw line.

Put up 14 points at St. John's (1/5) with eight rebounds and six assists.

Nabbed five rebounds and Louisville (12/10).

Scored eight points against Loyola-Chicago (12/4) followed by a seven-point performance against Duquesne (12/7).

Made DePaul debut against Northern Kentucky (11/26) with five points and four assists.

2020-21 (Oregon)

Appeared in 20 games with one start where he averaged 2.9 points in 11.6 points per game.

Totaled 15 points on 5-of-7 three-point shooting against Washington.

Scored 13 points on 5-of-7 shooting in first career start against Oregon State.

Grabbed five rebounds with two blocks against Portland (12/19).

Dished out five assists against Florida A&M.

Scored eight points and four rebounds against Eastern Washington.

Totaled nine points on three three-pointers against Seton Hall.

High School

Was a 2020 Michigan Mr. Basketball finalist after averaging 20.4 points, 6.5 assists, 5.4 rebounds and 2.6 steals per game as a senior.

Guided Beecher High School to a 20-2 record his senior year, finishing the season on an 18-game winning streak.

Named the Associated Press Division 3 Player of the Year for the second straight year as a senior.

Was a four-star guard ranked as the No. 57 player nationally by both Rivals and 247Sports.

No. 10 ranked point guard nationally and No. 2 player from the state of Michigan according to 247Sports.

Was named the Associated Press Division 3 Player of the Year as a junior after averaging 22.5 points, 7.0 rebounds, and 6.3 assists per game.

Led the Buccaneers to the state quarterfinals as a junior in 2018-19

Named to the Associated Press all-state first team his final three seasons in high school.
